Reviews.Title: so simple!
Reviews.Author: L.G.F.
Reviews.Content: I got the camera for my mom when her old one started to mess up.  I haven't really looked into any of the advanced features, but from just messing with it for less than 5 minutes I realized that this is the perfect camera for her.  While I need something a little more advanced, this is one of the closest digital cameras that I have seen  to a simple point-and-click camera.  It doesn't have a lot of fancy buttons, which is great because they tend to confuse my mom.  I was able to show her rather quickly how to turn it on, zoom, take a photo, and view photos.  This is all someone with her skill level needs to know how to do.Now I'm sure this camera has some advanced features that I haven't had a chance to see yet, but that's not why we bought it.  I have my own fancy camera that does cool stuff that my mom could never figure out how to use.  Trust me, she's tried.So if you just want a good quality, simple camera for someone who doesn't need to fool with features, then this is a great option at a wonderful price.

Reviews.Title: Easy Interface, Ultra Thin, Great Resolution
Reviews.Author: Gail Kaku
Reviews.Content: This camera replaces a Canon Powershot 400, which started to flake out. The J20 has an easy interface and is quite intuitive. Can't believe the price of this camera.My camera is tucked away in an IPOD case and fits like a glove. Maybe I won't need a camera case. I cut a little hole in the case and wove the camera strap through it. At the end of the strap,I attached a blackberry cleaning pad to it and use it to wipe away smudge marks.Overall, I'm very pleased with the size and weight and performance of this camera. Recommend using the flash indoors - colors are more natural. I've been wanting something ultra thin for a while now and finally found what I want.

Reviews.Title: good value but with some drawbacks
Reviews.Author: John Doe
Reviews.Content: My first fuji film camera. I ordered the black J20- the price is great I got mine new for 105$ w/ free shipping. (I also added a transcend 4GB/class 6 SDHC card & lowepro apex 20AW case.)I really like the styling, "ultra compact" small size, & 2.7" 230K pixel LCD. Wish it had a longer zoom. It's just an easy to use point & shoot that fills my needs for mostly taking family pics. 10MP is probably overkill though as most of my prints will be in the 4x6, 5x7 and 8x10 sizes (assuming true photo quality of 300 ppi). I can't wait to try the video mode out, I'll post more later.update: the 640x480 video w/ sound was big & clear, not small and choppy like I expected, w/ my 4GB card the recording time says 50min. To access the video mode you have to select it via the menu, there is no button on the camera itself. The shutter button on top starts/stops the video.Update 2 (after 1 month): I'm a little disappointed in the pics now, because so many I take seem to be just slightly out of focus. Not sure if this has to do with the lens itself or lack of optical image stabilization. Also, there is some shutter lag about 2-3 seconds, which can really ruin the shot you were hoping to get. Ive also had some issues recently where it wouldnt turn on, but removing the battery for a second then reinstalling then it would work.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ryan Kamminga ""The real deal""
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for work and it is awsome. Easy to use and that battery life is great, I've had it for over a month and still have not had to charge it. Great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: too good to be true
Reviews.Author: a selective shopper
Reviews.Content: this camera is quite small, easy to use, and has a big screen. wall charger works fast (1-2 hours for the initial charge)however, the flash is VERY BRIGHT, and washes out close items. it has a 3-4 second lag between pushing the button and taking the picture, unless you halfway depress the button to focus before you shoot (still takes a couple seconds, even then).also, it can't seem to handle sunny days, at least not on the 'auto' setting.a lot of the pictures came out blurry, and the stabilization setting can't be used at the same time as other settings.maybe i just didn't play with all the settings enough, but the lag time is what did it for me. i'm returning the camera and getting something else, even if i have to pay a little more =( very disappointing, but i guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Mark Devey "misterd40"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Father's Day and love it. I already own a Fujifilm SLR-type camera for more serious photography. However, I wanted a compact point and shoot for family photographs at restaurants, birthday parties, etc. With a more sophisticated camera it is nearly impossible to hand your camera to a waitress or stranger and ask them to take a group photo. When you do the photos often come out blurry, etc. Since this camera fits easily into my pants or shirt pocket, I can take it anywhere. In most instances, you would be hard pressed to tell the difference between the photos taken with my SLR type camera and this one. The different settings (e.g. "beach" and "fireworks")are intuitive and actually work as advertised. For me, this camera has three strong points: (1) it is the smallest, most compact camera I could find without having to pay two or three hundred dollars; (2) the viewing screen is quite large (my wife and daughter have more expensive Kodaks with much smaller viewing screens); and (3)it can be used right out of the box without the need for reading instruction booklets. I would agree with another reviewer that the lag time between pushing the button and the time the flash goes off takes a little getting used to. However, tell your subjects that you are going to take the picture on "three" and push the button on "two" and that takes care of the problem.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with the Camera and the Company behind it
Reviews.Author: RL "Ganbatteru-kun"
Reviews.Content: The compact size is great.  However, there is a significant lag in snapping a shot. By the time it does take a shot, the flash is a bit too much.  In regards to durability, the camera stopped working after about five months - wouldn't turn on.We contacted Fuji and although the camera was still well within the 1 year warranty period, they required a store receipt for warranty coverage.  This was hard to believe.  Historically, we've only held on to our receipts for the first 30 to 60 days in the event we wanted to return the product to the store.  We assume (and are correct in most cases) that the manufacturer can easily track the purchase date by serial number.  This was how it worked when I was in the electronics business 10 years ago.And, if you do have a problem, and have your receipt on hand, the battery isn't covered.  Considering an OEM replacement is about 1/3 the cost of the camera, I found this difficult to believe as well.However, all of this was our fault.  This is because it was our second purchase of a Fuji camera.  The first one was worse in terms of performance, so when it quit working, we didn't even bother trying to get it fixed.Should have known better.  Needless to say, we won't be purchasing another Fuji product again.

Reviews.Title: No durability or company backing
Reviews.Author: N. Tucker
Reviews.Content: The LCD screen lacks durability and Fujifilm doesn't back their product. I owned the camera for 3 weeks and a crack developed on the LCD screen causing it to black out. I sent it back to Fujifilm and they sent me a bill for $63.00 stating that a cracked LCD wasn't covered under warranty. I expressed my concern to their national mananger for camera repair and he would not standby his product and reduce the price or offer another to replace a defective LCD screen. I could understand if it would have been negligence on my part, but the camera practically sat on my countertop.

Reviews.Title: Fuji makes a fine camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia Barthold
Reviews.Content: I've had a fuji camera in the past and was very pleased. It is very compact & takes great pictures. I recommend this camera to anyone who likes to take their camera with them at all times.

Reviews.Title: Not durable
Reviews.Author: C. Fedeli
Reviews.Content: I haven't had his camera yet a year and it is now not working.  There is something wrong with the zoom.  When I turn it on now it says zoom error and it makes a clicking sound like some gear or part is now not functional. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Donna Burgess
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 12 year old daughter and she loves it! It takes really crisp pictures, is easy to use and small enough to carry in her purse.

Reviews.Title: LCD Crack
Reviews.Author: B. FINLEY
Reviews.Content: Similiar to the other review about LCD problem.  Had camera 3 months, removed from jacket pocket to take picture, and the screen was cracked.  Sent back for repair(thought it should be under warranty!!!); instead received a bill($61.36) for repairs.  The service center remarked "impact damage, LCD cracked" and is not covered under warranty.  This camera was not dropped, mishandled, abused, or impacted!  I refused service, and have since purchased another camera.  Beware!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great price, small camera, poor zoom
Reviews.Author: William Henderson Jr. "WAHJR"
Reviews.Content: I guess for the money (<$150) you can't complain too much.  This is the perfect sized camera for travel and ease of use.  It takes great simple close up pictures and all the features are basic and clear.  Two issues:  very poor zoom lens and sometimes the pictures are blurry.

Reviews.Title: It lasted a month....
Reviews.Author: Kathie Chi "Kat"
Reviews.Content: Wow, what can you say about a camera that had to be sent in for repairs 1 month after purchase when the lcd screen went kaplooey, and not because of mis-use either.  It had only taken about 115 pictures, but they do look good, none of the blurry that I had seen in other reviews.  The size and weight were nice and the battery seemed to hold up well for the few pictures we did take.  It will be interesting to see how it holds up when we get it back from repair.

Reviews.Title: Total waste of money, don't buy from this buyer
Reviews.Author: Tamie Jensen
Reviews.Content: The camera I received came with a charger, which does not work...........so the camera is a total waste.  No way to charge it, haven't even had it turned on so I don't know if the camera even works.  I can't find a charger for it either.  Very frustrating purchase.

Reviews.Title: It does meet my need
Reviews.Author: Harry Darang
Reviews.Content: It is not what I expected for the price I pay. I though a battery charger  it will come with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Frist digital
Reviews.Author: Joyce  Wallace
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my son after purchacing  identical.  He is is still using it and it is going strong taking beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Came quickly and works great
Reviews.Author: T. Peterson "Minnesota1"
Reviews.Content: I am in Afghanistan and only waited three weeks to get the camera.  Works great and takes great pictures even in combat.

Reviews.Title: It doesn't do everything, but it does well.
Reviews.Author: Sara Spaedy "Everything will be fine."
Reviews.Content: OK, so I was just browsing around and looking at products that I already own. Maybe that's strange. I have had this camera since fall of 2008, I think. Maybe it was spring 2009. Either way, I have had the camera for around 4 years. I don't remember what I paid for it. I think it was around $100 new from a department store. I bought it to use as a personal snap-shot-taker and also to use for my job at a pet store, where I took cute pictures of animals with their people to post on our blog. I used it allll the time. To take all kinds of pictures. Then, for about a year, it just rode around in the bottom of my purse, in a protective pouch, of course. I hardly ever used it, but I wanted it to be there just in case. Recently I have been using it more and more and I am grateful to have it!The picture quality is fantastic. In my experience, Fuji has always produced surprisingly GREAT quality images, even in their small, casual cameras like this J20. The colors are WONDERFUL and the focus is accurate, even if it's not lightning fast. (It's true. The camera can be slow to focus.) 10.0 megapixels is HUGE for a little camera like this. But this is a nice feature to have since the (optical) zoom is only 3x. Can't get close enough with the zoom? Zoom and crop on your photo editor on your computer! (Or crop the picture on the camera during playback mode!)As a point-and-shoot, it couldn't possibly disappoint. It is simple to use, attractive and compact.There are features like scene selection, shake reduction, macro, flash controls and timers that also make this camera suitable for more creative ventures. There is even a manual mode where you can set the ISO, white balance, and set exposure compensation. Most people who buy this camera will have no interest in these features, but they are there and they can make a big difference when you want to get a shot just right. I have recently become more interested in creating more artistic photographs, and I don't always have my "big" camera with me, so now my "little" camera is filling in as a creative tool, and it performs wonderfully. It doesn't give you complete control or fully manual settings for aperture, shutter speed or focus, but if you understand light and the abilities and limitations of whatever camera you are using, you're going to get a great shot!I have never had any issues with any part of the camera malfunctioning. The shutter and lens still function exactly as they did the day I bought it. It zooms in and out with no fuss. It focuses when I tell it to focus and flashes when I tell it to flash (or doesn't flash when I tell it not to). The LCD is not very bright or crisp, but it serves its purpose (your computer is the place to review your digital photos, anyhow) None of the 4 year-old pixels are damaged or burned out. The original battery is still going strong, although I expect to have to replace it someday, when necessary. It has always stored the images perfectly and has never had a corruption.It's a great little camera.The camera that takes the best pictures is the one you know well, and after spending 4 years with this one, we are good friends. Take the time to get to know your camera and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: dont waste your money.
Reviews.Author: Karisa L Crest
Reviews.Content: i owned a fuji camera prior to this one and it was awesome.never again will i buy a camera from amazon. this was problem after problem after problem... bought it used it think or just amazon crap??  couldn't cancel my order, didnt recieve it for almost a month AND then it didnt even work. it has serious problems reading memory cards so i spent $60 to take 12 pictures... yay.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Andersson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Wolf Camera a few years.  Paid too much there of course.  This is a great little point and shoot camera.  Very basic.  Would recomend.

Reviews.Title: simple & durable
Reviews.Author: umesh
Reviews.Content: This third year using this. Never thought will use this camera for such long time. Most interesting feature was the firework mode. It really captures very good video. Photos are of good quality. This my first Fujifilm.

Reviews.Title: Bad camera
Reviews.Author: Katy
Reviews.Content: I got the camera as a present and some months later I had the problem with the Zoom. There was written "Zoom-Mistake" and since then it hasn't worked well anymore. I sent it back to let it repair, I got it back and guess what, again the Zoom-mistake. Bad construction !!!

Reviews.Title: Cheaply made camera
Reviews.Author: Maggie Ferry
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift and after 6 months only I get a zoom error and it won't take any pictures. Looking online this is a common problem with this product. Not sure what to do with it now.

Reviews.Title: Bad
Reviews.Author: MAGI85
Reviews.Content: Compre esta camara hace unos meses y se rompio en menos de 6 meses lo mismo le paso a la anterior que tenia el lente se queda fuera y no entra mas es botar el dinero a la basura no sirven

Reviews.Title: Lousy camera, avoid this one!
Reviews.Author: Ryanst
Reviews.Content: The lens on this camera suffers from very noticeable vignetting (dark corners). Not just subtle light falloff, but major vignetting (dark grey corners). Be forewarned, this is not a problem with the particular camera I have, but rather a poorly designed lens.I do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love Fuji...HATE J20
Reviews.Author: Nic
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this camera. I'm surprised that Fuji hasn't pulled it to save their name. Very long, strange delay when taking pictures especially with flash. Really hard to see display during the day. What happened Fuji? I am or was a big Fuji fan and this camera baffles me. Much better choice is Fuji Z37.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: Dale Olson
Reviews.Content: great camera! I took this on a trip to Europe and every one in my family was amazed by the pictures. I love that it fits easily into your pocket so it is very portable. I have only 1 complaint--the way to change your settings from snow photos to night time to portrait ect. was too slow. the camera would be improved by a click-wheel instead of searching the menu. Great camera and durable too!

Reviews.Title: J10 Fujifilm Camera Sucks
Reviews.Author: Juliette
Reviews.Content: I HATE THIS CAMERA! the entire lens felm off when i dropped it on carpet. i dont recomend this piece of crap at all. it takes horrible quality pictures and videos. there are literally no effects (such as black and white, sepia, etc.). it is so loud. it makes noise every time you press a button. don't  buy this. dont recomend it.

Reviews.Title: Worked great... until it didn't (flash detection)
Reviews.Author: K. Snodgrass "katstr"
Reviews.Content: I really liked the photo quality of my pictures relative to my friends' more expensive cameras. However, after about 6 months of use, the flash detection sensor would sometimes quit detecting the light ... it would sit there forever trying to detect what it needed to do until I would have to turn it off and turn it back on till the automatic flash started working again. After about a month of that, it would always have that problem, and unless I turned the flash off completely, the camera wouldn't work. Since I'm lazy, I never sent the camera in for repairs but have no purchased a new camera.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: T. Seavoy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at another outlet 5 months ago.  At first it worked OK.  Today, after taking it off the shelf where it sat for 3 months, it would not come one. I charged the battery, checked the voltage (4.1V) and it still would not come on. I doubt that it's worth the postage to send it back.Tom Seavoy

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: A. Rader
Reviews.Content: It is just like one in the store. I have not had it long enough to say anything about the battery.

ProductInfo.Features:
10.0-megapixel resolution for large, photo quality prints
3x optical zoom; Picture Stabilization and Anti-blur Mode
2.7-inch LCD screen with Micro Thumbnail View
Slim, 17.4mm profile
20 MB built-in memory; capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix J20 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom
